item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: A40 Road Closure - traffic diverted through East End Road, 4th September
item.description:
The diversions for the A40 road closure do not appear to be working - with exceptional volumes of traffic using East End Road including huge lorries. In addition, there is limited pavement available due to ongoing parking issues. Cars driving down are mounting the pavement due to the congestion. I believe that an accident is just a matter of time. The repairs on the A40 need to cease until a realistic diversion plan is developed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, East End Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain not sufficient for road, gets blocked every time there is heavy rain and then our church hall has been flooded last year, we had to clear this today to prevent another flood, of which we are still recovering from last years downpour., 4th September
item.description:
Outside Elim church about 2 meters to the right of the lamp post. The 2 drains further up are uphill, so do not do anything to help. This has been a problem every year when it is autumn and very heavy rains since the road was redone about 3 years ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115-117, Saint Georges Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two deep potholes on eastbound side of Church Road opposite Waverley, 4th September
item.description:
The eastbound side of Church Road opposite Waverley. They are both sharp edged enough to puncture my bike tyres if I hadn't spotted them, and might have unseated me too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Construction barriers left on Copt Elm Road, 4th September
item.description:
Between Copt Elm Close and Grovelands Close on the right hand side of the road travelling up Copt Elm Road. Have been there close to a year with zero work. Obstructing pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copt Elm Road, Cheltenham

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding WILL cause accidents with children at crossing, 4th September
item.description:
The water does NOT drain within an hour. The drain is on HIGH ground. This has been a KNOWN PROBLEM for over 8 months. HUNDREDS of children cross here twice a day every weekday. When it rains and floods, the children are forced onto the cycle path. A cyclist will hit a child. I was told the problem had been identified and this would be fixed BEFORE school re-started by GCC: "Following post-construction inspections, the team has identified that remedial work is necessary at this location to correct the levels. We plan to address this issue during the installation of the footpath extension and gully repositioning, which are part of the ongoing cycleway expansion project. We anticipate completing these improvements and remedial work by the end of spring 2025."

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
